benchmark_details.name: RoboTwin: Dual-Arm Robot Benchmark with Generative Digital Twins
benchmark_details.overview: RoboTwin introduces a generative digital twin framework to produce diverse expert datasets and provides a real-world-aligned evaluation platform for dual-arm robotic tasks, enabling standardized evaluation and better alignment between simulated training and real-world performance.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of RoboTwin is to assess dual-arm robots' performance using synthetic data generated through a generative digital twin framework.

data.source: 300 RoboTwin-generated samples and 20 real-world samples for each task.
data.size: 100 sets of simulation data and 20 sets of real-world data per task
data.annotation: Expert demonstrations are generated via a large language model combined with object annotations.

methodology.calculation: Success rate determined by meeting target pose constraints and ensuring collision-free execution.
methodology.interpretation: Higher success rates indicate better performance in task execution.
methodology.baseline_results: Policies trained on 300 RoboTwin-generated data improve success rates significantly over those trained solely on real-world data.
methodology.validation: Validated using the open-source COBOT Magic Robot platform with simulated task execution.
